alert.note: Alert for Collingsworth; Wheeler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:43PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Wheeler and north central Collingsworth Counties through 230 PM CDT... At 143 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 4 miles northwest of Lela, or 9 miles west of Shamrock, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shamrock, Wheeler, Lela and Twitty. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
